text: Josef Hassmann (21 May 1910 – 1 November 1969) was an Austrian football forward . He played for Austria in the 1934 FIFA World Cup.Copa do Mundo da FIFA Itália 1934 He also played for SK Admira Wien, FC Wien, SV Straßenbahn, and SK Rapid Wien. ==Career== Josef Hassmann began his career as a teenager at Admira but switched to FC Wien in 1931, then called FC Nicholson. Although the striker was not able to play for the title with the favorites, he recommended himself to the national team with good performances under Hugo Meisl. The striker was called up for the 1934 World Cup in Italy, where Austria reached the semi-finals. Josef Hassmann was not used. He finally made his team debut on 11 November 1934 in a 3-0 win over Switzerland. He only played one more international match, against Czechoslovakia in 1935. In 1937 Josef Hassmann left FC Vienna and played for Straßenbahn and SK Rapid. He retired in 1945. ==References== Category:1910 births Category:1969 deaths Category:Austrian footballers Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:Association football forwards Category:SK Rapid Wien players Category:Austrian football forwards
title: Josef Hassmann
